Package com.bewsoftware.utils.reflect

Class Reflect

java.lang.Object
com.bewsoftware.utils.reflect.Reflect
public final class Reflect extends Object
The primary purpose of this class, is to assist in Unit Testing classes with hidden members.

By using reflection, testing can be done without requiring the changing of the public interface of the class.
In addition, reflection allows the testing of the internal code to help maintain required end results.

Since:
1.0.5
Version:
1.0.7
Author:
Bradley Willcott

  • Method Details

    • getPrivateAttribute

      public static Field getPrivateAttribute(Object instance, String name) throws ReflectiveOperationException
      Get access to a private attribute/field of a class instance.

      Example:
      The follow classes would be in separate files: Person.java and Main.java.

      public class Person {
    private String name;

    private Person() {
        name = "not set";
    }

    public String toString() {
        return "Person { name = " + name + " }";
    }
}

public class Main {
    public static void main() {
        Person person = Reflect.instantiatePrivateClass(Person.class);
        Field name = Reflect.getPrivateAttribute(person, "name");
        name.set(person, "Fred Smith");
        System.out.println("name = " + name.get(person));
        System.out.println(person);
}
}

      name = Fred Smith
Person { name = Fred Smith }
      Parameters:
      instance - The instantiated Class object.
      name - The name of the class attribute to get.
      Returns:
      The Field object representing the required class attribute, or null if not found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if name is blank.
      NullPointerException - if either instance or name are null.
      ReflectiveOperationException - if a reflective operation failed.

    • getPrivateMethod

      public static Method getPrivateMethod(Object instance, String name, Object... sampleArgs) throws ReflectiveOperationException
      Get access to a private method of a class instance.

      Example:
      The follow classes would be in separate files: Person.java and Main.java.

      public class Person {
    private String name;

    private Person() {
        name = "not set";
    }

    private String getName() {
        return name;
    }

    private void setName(String name) {
        this.name = name;
    }

    public String toString() {
        return "Person { name = " + name + " }";
    }
}

public class Main {
    public static void main() {
        Person person = Reflect.instantiatePrivateClass(Person.class);
        Method setName = Reflect.getPrivateMethod(person, "setName", "text");
        Method getName = Reflect.getPrivateMethod(person, "getName");
        setName.invoke(person, "Peter Adams");
        System.out.println("name = " + getName.invoke(person));
        System.out.println(person);
}
}

      name = Peter Adams
Person { name = Peter Adams }
      Parameters:
      instance - The instantiated Class object.
      name - The name of the class attribute to get.
      sampleArgs - Sample arguments/parameters. Used only to obtain their Class<?> types.
      Returns:
      The Method object representing the required class method, or null if not found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if name is blank.
      NullPointerException - if either instance or name are null.
      ReflectiveOperationException - if a reflective operation failed.

    • instantiatePrivateClass

      public static <T> T instantiatePrivateClass(Class<T> clazz, Object... args) throws ReflectiveOperationException
      Instantiate a class with a private parameterized constructor. To access the default constructor, only provide the clazz parameter.

      Example:
      The follow classes would be in separate files: Person.java and Main.java.

      public class Person {
    private String name;

    private Person() {
        name = "not set";
    }

    private Person(String name) {
        this.name = name;
    }

    public String toString() {
        return "Person { name = " + name + " }";
    }
}

public class Main {
    public static void main() {
        Person person = instantiatePrivateClass(Person.class);
        System.out.println(person);

        person = instantiatePrivateClass(Person.class, "Jane Doe");
        System.out.println(person);
}
}

      Person { name = not set }
Person { name = Jane Doe }
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the reference.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class to instantiated.
      args - The parameters to be passed to the constructor.
      Returns:
      The newly instantiated object, or null if the required constructor is not found.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if clazz is null.
      ReflectiveOperationException - if a reflective operation failed.

    • checkConstructorSignature

      private static <T> T checkConstructorSignature(int numParams, Constructor<?> con, Class<?>[] types, T rtn, Object[] args) throws IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException, InstantiationException
      Check the signature of the constructor.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the reference.
      Parameters:
      numParams - The number of required parameters.
      con - The constructor to check.
      types - Class types of the required parameters.
      rtn - Provides the return type reference.
      args - List of arguments to pass to the constructor on instantiation.
      Returns:
      The new instantiated object, or the value of the parameter: rtn.
      Throws:
      IllegalAccessException - if this Constructor object is enforcing Java language access control and the underlying constructor is inaccessible.
      InstantiationException - if the class that declares the underlying constructor represents an abstract class.
      InvocationTargetException - if the underlying constructor throws an exception.
